article.headline: Johnson & Johnson stock outperforms market on strong trading day
article.body: Shares of Johnson & Johnson JNJ, +1.39% rallied 1.40% to $150.97 Friday, on what proved to be an all-around favorable trading session for the stock market, with the S&P 500 Index SPX, +0.87% rising 0.88% to 3,477.14 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.56% rising 0.57% to 28,586.90. This was the stock's third consecutive day of gains. Johnson & Johnson closed $6.03 short of its 52-week high ($157.00), which the company achieved on April 23rd. The stock demonstrated a mixed performance when compared to some of its competitors Friday, as Roche Holding AG Part. Cert. RHHVF, +2.93% rose 2.93% to $351.00, Merck & Co. Inc. MRK, -0.14% fell 0.15% to $80.36, and Pfizer Inc. PFE, -0.27% fell 0.27% to $36.79. Trading volume (5.0 M) remained 773,602 below its 50-day average volume of 5.8 M. Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights using data from Dow Jones and FactSet. See our market data terms of use.
